content.description: Start with right hand on the obvious low sloper and a left foot in one of the indents. Move into the side pull sloper and then top out.
content.protection: Pads, be careful of the drop to the left.
content.location:
33°59'24.9"N 116°04'01.8"W

Approximate location

Southwest side of one of the Jumbo rocks immediately in Jumbo Rock Campgrounds.

Minor Scrambling may be needed for the approach.

content.description: The route is a steep handcrack (50 feet) followed by a wide section. A thin crack on the right intersects the route about halfway up. Descent: hike left then right.
content.protection: Gear: #.4-#4 Camalots, large stoppers, and some small Tricams for the belay.
content.location: Just after entering the Jumbo Rocks campground two prominent formations can be seen to the right (southwest). These formations run southeast to northwest. This climb is on the steep northeast-face of the second (farthest right) formation about 100 feet from the northwest end. It can be reached by coming in from either end of the canyon formed by the two formations but approaching from the southeast is easier.
